meanings.definition: A person who believes in or advocates for the theory of connectionism.
meanings.sent1: As a connectionist, she strongly supports the idea that learning occurs through interconnected nodes.
meanings.sent2: The conference was attended by many connectionists who shared their research on neural networks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the connectionist bring a router to the party? To make sure everyone stayed connected!
meanings.sent4: The connectionists in the room were like nodes in a vast network, each contributing to the collective knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The young student became a connectionist after learning about the brain's interconnected pathways.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who study or work in the field of connectionism.
meanings.sent1: The connectionists gathered for a symposium to discuss the latest advancements in neural networks.
meanings.sent2: Many universities have research teams composed of connectionists exploring artificial intelligence.
meanings.sent3: The connectionists decided to form a band called 'The Neural Networks' to play at the science fair.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, connectionists are the architects of the digital brain.
meanings.sent5: The collaboration between connectionists led to groundbreaking discoveries in cognitive science.
